fields.Title: INITIATION / PYRHOLIDON HABIT
fields.Description: A thought for becoming a wonderful pyrholidon addict.

fields.Title: You: "Tastes like gasoline."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tastes like gasoline.

fields.Title: You: "Wait -- radiation poisoning sounds..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait -- radiation poisoning sounds scary.

fields.Title: You: "Slurp it *aggressively*."
fields.Dialogue Text: Slurp it *aggressively*.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Electrochemistry: "No problem. This one's for the brav..."]
You: "This is going to be *so* useful in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This is going to be *so* useful in my line of work. [Finish thought.]

fields.Title: You: "Will I be able to stand straight an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Will I be able to stand straight and walk?

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Just don't *mix* it with anything,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just don't *mix* it with anything, he thinks, looking you over. Thankfully his sense of balance seems okay. Whatever. I'm not getting involved.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Look at all these guys go off like..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look at all these guys go off like fireworks as information pours into you -- about the lieutenant's simple remark: *I'm happy for you*. This stuff is great.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Why not? This government-developed..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why not? This government-developed substance seems very non-intrusive. You could even operate heavy machinery! Fire-machinery!

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a manly dose of the extrem..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You suck a manly dose of the extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

fields.Title: You: "Hmm... open the cap."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hmm... open the cap.

fields.Title: You: "Tastes like... an anti-radiation dr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tastes like... an anti-radiation drug.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "It tastes like *many* things, all m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It tastes like *many* things, all melting into one conflagration in the back of your throat. As you look around, the world slowly *exists*. As it did before. Only now gentle flames lick at its edges, as though it were a photo burning.

fields.Title: You: "I'm not going to slurp it. [Ignore..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm not going to slurp it. [Ignore thought.]

fields.Title: Empathy: "This warmth. It makes you want to s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This warmth. It makes you want to share your *discovery* with Kim!

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Please don't actually operate any f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Please don't actually operate any fire-machines.

fields.Title: Tutorial Agent: "In the bottom right corner of the s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In the bottom right corner of the screen there's a PYRHOLIDON button! It gives +1 to PSYCHE skills: Empathy, Suggestion, Authority, Inland Empire, Esprit de Corps, and Volition. This is good before rolling a White Check -- but damages your Health.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "No. Of course not really. It's just..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. Of course not really. It's just a metaphor. The effect of that otherworldly drop of liquid is slower, more subtle than that of real flames -- yet just as warm.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "Wow, Kim's bad ass. *Or* he's had a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wow, Kim's bad ass. *Or* he's had a druggie partner? Whoa. That's probably it! He's seen it before.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Already you can tell you're going t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Already you can tell you're going to be slurping a *lot* more pyrholidon! This stuff is going to give you insight into that little flickering light hidden in all human beings.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "The container is warm to the touch..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The container is warm to the touch -- or is that just the anticipation? You screw the lid open and look. A little slit on the side lets you just *slurp* it up, like an oyster! C'mon! Slurp it!

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a minuscule drop of extrem..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You suck a minuscule drop of extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

fields.Title: You: "Tastes like a kiss."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tastes like a kiss.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Of course, it's just a metaphor. It..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Of course, it's just a metaphor. It's just a metaphor. The effect of that otherworldly drop of liquid is slower, more subtle than that of real flames -- yet just as warm.

fields.Title: Endurance: "If you can keep the vomit in. Becau..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If you can keep the vomit in. Because it sort of also makes you want to throw up.

fields.Title: Endurance: "You need to lower the radiation lev..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You need to lower the radiation levels, your stomach thinks. Slurp it.

fields.Title: You: "That's really not what I'm looking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's really not what I'm looking for. [Ignore thought.]

fields.Title: You: "Slurp it, but only a little."
fields.Dialogue Text: Slurp it, but only a little.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Not *really*. It's just a metaphor...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not *really*. It's just a metaphor. The effect of that otherworldly drop of liquid is slower, more subtle than that of real flames -- yet just as warm.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "No problem. This one's for the brav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No problem. This one's for the brave and sensitive ones anyway. It could improve your human interactions. But -- you threw that chance away. No matter, in a few hours you'll get the urge again. Maybe then you'll choose more courageously?

fields.Title: You: "Really?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Really?

fields.Title: You: "Oh god, on *fire*?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh god, on *fire*?

fields.Title: You: "Tastes like fire."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tastes like fire.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "His glasses turn golden as the fire..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His glasses turn golden as the fire reflects off the lenses. You feel this man is your brother.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Whoa! In your hand: *pyrholidon* --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whoa! In your hand: *pyrholidon* -- the double rainbow of synthetic hallucinogens. Rare and gritty, a product of the age of atomic power.

fields.Title: You: "Look at the little puck of liquid."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look at the little puck of liquid.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "What is he, your mother? Is Kim you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What is he, your mother? Is Kim your *au pair*? Slurp it, slurp the morsel of danger-joy!

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a manly dose of the extrem..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You suck a manly dose of the extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

fields.Title: You: "No. I can't see it."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. I can't see it.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm happy for you," he answers."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm happy for you," he answers.

fields.Title: You: "Atomic power? Too scary. [Ignore th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Atomic power? Too scary. [Ignore thought.]

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "You suck a minuscule drop of extrem..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You suck a minuscule drop of extremely chemical-smelling liquid into your mouth. There it seeps into your tongue. When you swallow it's already almost all gone.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "What a funny little cap! Don't let..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What a funny little cap! Don't let the *scary* medical warnings throw you off. It's an inadequate antidote to radiation poisoning, but a *potent* antidote to *boredom*.

fields.Title: You: "Wait, won't Kim see me slurp it?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait, won't Kim see me slurp it?

fields.Title: Tutorial Agent: "You've passed up your chance to sta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've passed up your chance to start using PYRHOLIDON for now, but don't worry! The option to use it becomes available again in 4 hours.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "It's not gonna *give* you radiation..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's not gonna *give* you radiation poisoning, stupid. Pyrholidon is a perfect match for a bad-ass junkie cop who's looking for a little *heat*.

fields.Title: You: ""Kim, I just did a drop of that ant..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, I just did a drop of that anti-radiation drug. It's great."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "His glasses turn golden as the fire..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His glasses turn golden as the fire reflects off the lenses. Once again, you are filled with the certainty: this man is your brother.
